Name: Figurine
Description: Bronze figure of a child god, probably Horus as a child (Harpocrates) wearing a headcloth, a sidelock, an uraeus and an atef-crown, otherwise he is naked and in seated position, the throne missing. Such bronze images of deities have been found in great numbers at shrines of Late Period and Ptolemaic date. This example is much worn, and broken away at the knees and left wrist.
